name: St. Richard Gwyn

locations.description: Welsh schoolmaster and martyr in Wrexham, Wales

summary: Richard Gwyn was a Welsh Catholic martyr who was executed during the reign of Elizabeth I. He was a schoolmaster who refused to attend Protestant services and was arrested multiple times. He was tried, found guilty of treason, and hanged, drawn, and quartered. He is one of the Forty Martyrs of England and Wales and is the protomartyr of Wales. He is remembered for his steadfast faith and courage.
